case: A free help desk is provided
definition: The service can be easily contacted for questions or provides a support center at no extra cost.

case: A license is kept on user-generated content even after you close your account
definition: The service may still use your content and display it after you stopped using it by closing your account. The case applies to terms requiring users to grant them a perpetual license over that content.

case: A list of all cookies set by the website is provided
definition: The service provides users with a complete list of all first and third party cookies its website sets and an explanation of their uses. This information can be valuable for users to make an informed choice whether to allow those cookies.

case: Accessibility to this service is guaranteed at 99% or more
All Traffic is unencrypted (no https)
definition: The service doesn't employ TLS/SSL encryption to secure the traffic between your browser and the website you're visiting. As a result the data transmitted may be monitored by unauthorized third parties.

case: Alternative accounts are not allowed
definition: Services that do not allow multiple or alternative accounts are covered by this case. Alternative accounts can contribute to an increased privacy, but can also be used to manipulate discussions and polls and might decrease the trustworthiness of a person.

case: An anonymous payment method is offered
definition: Some services allow payments via cryptocurrencies, so that users don't need to reveal their identity to payment processors.

case: An audio version of the Terms of Service is provided
definition: This service provides an audio file of someone reading the agreements for users to play and listen to.

case: An onion site accessible over Tor is provided
definition: Tor is a software for anonymous communication that directs Internet traffic through an overlay network. Onion sites are only available through Tor browser and provide additional security and anonymity to users.

case: Any liability on behalf of the service is only limited to the fees you paid as a user
App required for this service requires broad device permissions
definition: The app of the service requires more device permissions than necessary. As a consequence it can compromise your privacy by accessing many functions and information from your device, such as precise location, contacts, device identifiers etc.

case: Archives of their agreements are provided so that changes can be viewed over time
definition: This case applies to Services whose agreements provide previous versions, so that users can compare them and understand how the Service seems to evolve regarding user rights.

case: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service
definition: Most browsers allow users to set preferences related to cookies storage. You may choose to block all cookies (including first-party cookies), but it may impact your use of this service and you may not be able to access some or any of the features provided.

case: Conditions may change, but your continued acceptance is not inferred from an earlier acceptance
definition: When you're not logged in to a service, but use it repeatedly, it may still feel weird that their terms and conditions can change between one use and the next. However, this does not violate the rule-of-thumb that each new version should be accepted from scratch, without inferring your acceptance from the acceptance of an earlier version. Since no acceptance is inferred from continued use, but only from current use, we rate this as neutral instead of bad.

case: Content is published under a free license instead of a bilateral one
definition: User-generated content, such as posts or comments, is published under a free license, meaning other users can reuse it (e.g. Creative Commons license).

case: Content you post may be edited by the service for any reason
definition: This service can edit any content on the service for whatever the reason and at their sole discretion.

case: Copyright license limited for the purposes of that same service but transferable and sublicenseable
Critical changes to the terms are made without user involvement
definition: They may significantly update the terms at any time and at their sole discretion, meaning for any reason and without necessarily taking into account the interests or suggestions of the users of the Service.

case: Defend, indemnify, hold harmless; survives termination
Details are provided about what kind of information they collect
definition: The Privacy Policy describes in detail the data collected through the website and through the services provided.

case: Do Not Track (DNT) headers are ignored and you are tracked anyway even if you set this header.
definition: Even though the Do Not Track (DNT) header was not implemented perfectly, services should not track users whose browsers send a DNT header.

case: Extra data may be collected about you through promotions
definition: Additional personal data may be collected through contests, surveys, promotions, petitions or sweepstakes.

case: Failure to enforce any provision of the Terms of Service does not constitute a waiver of such provision
definition: Even if the service does not or not always enforce all of the rules or provisions contained in its terms, they still apply. Users can at a later time still be held accountable for violating provisions that have not been enforced consistently.

case: Features of the website are made available under a free software license
definition: This case applies to services under licenses that are free as in "freedom". According to the Free Software Foundation, "free software is the software that grants the user the freedom to share, study, and modify it". Furthermore, the code is entirely open source and may be used without any restriction, including for commercial purposes.

case: First-party cookies are used
definition: First-party cookies only belong to the domain of the service and not a third party.

case: Harming minors in any ways is prohibited
definition: This service prohibits harming minor in any ways. Since both “minor” and “in any ways” are vague and can be cited to restrict possibly any actions, the case is not classified as “good”.

case: If you are the target of a copyright claim, your content may be removed
definition: This service prohibits harming minor in any ways. Since both “minor” and “in any ways” are vague and can be cited to restrict possibly any actions, the case is not classified as “good”.

case: If you are the target of a copyright holder's take down notice, this service gives you the opportunity to defend yourself
definition: The content you have published on the service may be removed if it infringes copyright.

case: If you offer suggestions to the service, they become the owner of the ideas that you give them
definition: You have the right to send a counter-notice to the service if you believe the content that was removed wasn't infringing any copyright.

case: If you offer suggestions to the service, they may use that without your approval or compensation, but they do not become the owner
definition: The service can claim ownership on feedback, proposals, ideas and suggestions submitted by the users, who may waive their "moral rights" on that feedback.

case: Inconvenient process for obtaining personal data
definition: This applies to cases where obtaining personal data requires sending a written letter by mail or is otherwise more complicated and time consuming than necessary.

case: Information is gathered about you through third parties
definition: This Service may employ, either identifiable or non-identifiable, data collection from third party sources about you.

case: Information is provided about how they collect personal data
definition: The service details situations in which they collect personal information or means by which they do.

case: Information is provided about how your personal data is used
definition: The Privacy Policy explains the purposes for which data is collected and the way it is processed, used and shared.

case: Information is provided about security practices
definition: It's important to know what security measures are taken to protect your data from unauthorized access. This case applies to the Agreements that precisely explain their security practices.

case: Instead of asking directly, this Service will assume your consent merely from your usage.
definition: The Service infers your acceptance from your continued usage, instead of prompting you to read the Terms and asking for direct consent.

case: Instructions are provided on how to submit a copyright claim
definition: If content that you own is copied or made accessible through the service in a way that constitutes an intellectual property right infringement, you can report it following the instructions given in the agreements.

case: Invalidity of any portion of the Terms of Service does not entail invalidity of its remainder
definition: Should any portion of the Terms of Service be unenforceable or invalid, that portion will be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and the remainder of the TOS will remain valid and enforceable.

case: IP addresses of website visitors are not tracked
definition: Should any portion of the Terms of Service be unenforceable or invalid, that portion will be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and the remainder of the TOS will remain valid and enforceable.

case: Logs are deleted after a finite period of time
definition: Logs are text files containing some information about web visitors, such as user agents (showing for instance that you're connecting from Firefox for Android) and ip addresses (which reveal your approximate location). This case applies to Services that periodically delete their logs to prevent user sessions being tracked over time.

case: Logs are kept for an undefined period of time
definition: The service collects different kinds of personal data, such as name, demographic information, postal address, biometric data, device information, IDs, contacts, call logs...

case: Many different types of personal data are collected
definition: The service collects different kinds of personal data, such as name, demographic information, postal address, biometric data, device information, IDs, contacts, call logs...

case: Many third parties are involved in operating the service
Minors must have the authorization of their legal guardians to use the service
definition: Minors must have the authorization of their legal guardians to use the services. The legal guardians are responsible for the use of the service by the minor.

case: No guarantee is given regarding quality
definition: The Service doesn't warrant or guarantee the quality of the products or services provided.

case: No need to register
definition: This service can be used without providing a user profile.

case: No third-party analytics or tracking platforms are used
definition: There are no Google Analytics or other tracking codes embedded in the service. Any tracking is performed by the service itself.

case: Only aggregate data is given to third parties
definition: The Service only shares your information in an aggregated form, which means an anonymized form that can't be linked to a unique identity.

case: only for your individual use
Only necessary logs are kept by the service to ensure quality
definition: Logs are text files containing some information about web visitors, such as user agents (showing for instance that you're connecting from Firefox for Android) and ip addresses (which reveal your approximate location). This case applies to Services that only keep the strictly necessary logs on their servers and therefore protect your privacy.

case: Only temporary session cookies are used
definition: Temporary session cookies are cookies that are deleted when you close your browser instead of remaining there until they are manually deleted (or expire). These cookies are only used for the purposes of the service and therefore disappear when it's no longer used.

case: Other applicable rules, terms, conditions or guidelines
definition: Use of the service is subject also to an exhaustive list of other documents containing rules, guidelines, terms or policies (in addition to the obvious Terms of Service/Terms of Use and Privacy Policy/Data Use Policy)

case: Per the service's terms, you may not express negative opinions about them
definition: Criticizing, questioning, making objections or complaints about the Service, its staff or anything related to it is prohibited and constitutes a breach of the Terms.

case: Personal information that is shared outside its jurisdiction is processed according to the original jurisdiction's data protection standards
definition: The service has arrangements in place to ensure that users' personal information, if shared with an entity outside of the service's jurisdiction, is processed to the same standards that apply to the processing of personal data in the service's jurisdiction.

case: Political discussions or campaigning are prohibited
definition: Political content in the form or pictures, discussions, or campaigning isn't allowed.

case: Political discussions which are against the government-advocated value are prohibited
definition: Political content, which is against the government-advocated value, in the form or pictures, discussions, or campaigning isn't allowed. Since it encourages the promotional content of the value, the service may tolerate trolling or spamming against political rivals or enemies.

case: Prices and fees may be changed at any time, without notice to you
definition: The service reserves the right to change or modify its pricing and fees at any time, and such changes are effective immediately without need for further notice to the user.

case: Private messages can be read
definition: The Service is able to access, scan, review or read all user communications, including private messages, which may contain personal or sensitive data.

case: Promises will be kept after a merger or acquisition
definition: If the service gets acquired or needs to transfer personal data after a merger, bankruptcy, reorganization or sale of the services, the data will still be processed in a manner that honours the promises made in the agreements.

case: Pseudonyms are allowed
definition: You don't need to provide your full name to use the Service and you are allowed to use a pseudonym instead.

case: Pseudonyms are allowed due to the service's billing policies
Sensitive data is collected and shared to target advertising
definition: Sensitive data refers to information requiring special protection, such as health data, political and religious beliefs, ethnic origins, sexual life and financial information. The service collects and shares this data with third parties for advertising or marketing.

case: Separate policies are employed for different parts of the service
definition: The user may need to read additional product-specific agreements depending on the way the service is used.

case: Service fines users for Terms of Service violations
definition: Service fines users for violating provisions in the Terms of Service

case: Some personal data may be kept for business interests or legal obligations
definition: After the end of the data retention period and/or if you request the deletion of your data, they may still keep it for business interests (fraud detection, transactions...) or legal obligations (tax, legal reporting...)

case: Specific content can be deleted without reason and may be removed without prior notice
definition: This service can delete specific content. Usually they will claim they reserve the right to do it at their sole discretion, which is legalese for saying they won't give a specific reason. If the terms say they will not notify you, it shall be included in the quote but if it does not explicitly say they will give you a notice, it can be reasonably inferred that they can do it without telling you.

case: Spidering, crawling, or accessing the site through any automated means is not allowed
Terms may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to you
definition: The Agreements can be updated at any time, including in a way that negatively affects user rights, without notifying before or after the changes.

case: The cookies used by this service do not contain information that would personally identify you
definition: The cookies used only collect anonymous, aggregated data that cannot be linked to a unique identity.

case: The copyright license maintained by the service over your data and/or content is broader than necessary.
The copyright license that you grant this service is limited to the parties that make up the service's broader platform.
The court of law governing the terms is in a jurisdiction that is friendlier to user privacy protection.
definition: The Terms are governed by the applicable laws of a jurisdiction known for protecting citizens privacy with strong data regulations. Usually contributors will need to explain in the Analysis view of each point linked to this Case why the jurisdiction is friendly to user privacy protection.

case: The court of law governing the terms is in a jurisdiction that is less friendly to user privacy protection.
definition: The Terms are governed by the applicable laws of a jurisdiction known for weak data regulations and poor user privacy protection. Usually contributors will need to explain in the Analysis view of each point linked to this Case the reason why it shall be applied.

case: The court of law governing the terms is in location X
definition: The Terms are governed by the applicable laws of a jurisdiction (specified in the title of each point by replacing the "X").

case: The data retention period is kept to the minimum necessary for fulfilling its purposes
definition: The service will remove personal data from its systems once it is no longer required. Depending on the type of information and the reason it was collected, data retention periods will vary.

case: The policy refers to documents that are missing or unfindable
definition: For instance, when the privacy policy refers to the cookie policy, but there is no link to a cookie policy, anywhere. It only applies to services that are impossible to contact to raise the issue, either because they don't offer any contact method or they do not respond in a reasonable time.

case: The posting of pornographic content is prohibited
definition: Users are not allowed to post any content of pornographic nature. This includes adult content, things that are sexually explicit, or obscene.

case: The publishing of personally identifiable information without the owner's consent is not allowed
definition: Users agree not to publicly post personally identifiable information (name, postal address, contact information…) without the owner’s knowledge or consent

case: The service can intervene in user disputes
definition: If you have a dispute with another user on this service, they can review the issue and intervene. However, they don't have an obligation to do so.

case: The service claims to be CCPA compliant for California users
definition: The service has a different behavior towards users protected by the California Consumer Privacy Act.

case: The service claims to be GDPR compliant for European users
definition: The service has a different behavior towards users protected by the GDPR.

case: The service claims to be LGPD compliant for Brazilian users
definition: The service has a different behavior towards users protected by the Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados Pessoais.

case: The service deletes tracking data after a period of time and allows you to opt out
The service disables software that you are not licensed to use.
definition: The service disables software that you are not licensed to use.

case: The service does not guarantee accuracy or reliability of the information provided
definition: This service makes no warranty regarding the accuracy or reliability of any information that is given on its website or the results that may be obtained from the use of the service.

case: The service does not guarantee that software errors will be corrected
definition: Users agree to use the service and its software as provided and accept that any errors within that software may not be corrected.

case: The service does not index or open files that you upload
The service explains how to prevent disclosure of personal information to third parties
The service has a no refund policy
definition: Payments are final and can't be refunded unless required by law.

case: The service has non-exclusive use of your content
definition: The service can pay for your content and you are allowed to make it commercially available to other services/parties.

case: The service informs you that its privacy policy does not apply to third party websites
definition: The service states that whenever it links to third party websites or applications, its privacy policy does not apply. Those third party websites or applications hosted or operated by other organizations may have their own privacy policies.

case: The service is not responsible for linked or (clearly) quoted content from third-party content providers
The service is not transparent regarding government requests or inquiries that may involve your data.
The service is only available in some countries approved by its government
definition: Countries under embargo or banned by the government of the country in question cannot use the service.

case: The service is open-source
definition: The code of the software is open-source and the users can have access to the source code.

case: The service is provided 'as is' and to be used at your sole risk
The service is transparent regarding government requests or inquiries that may involve your data.
The service may keep a secure, anonymized record of your data for analytical purposes even after the data retention period
definition: The data retention period states how long a service keeps user data. In this case, the service may anonymize the personal data after its retention period is over and use it for analytical or research purposes.

case: The service promises to inform and/or notify you regarding government inquiries that may involve your personal data
definition: In case the Government governing the Terms requests personal data of a user of this service, they will make reasonable efforts to inform/notify the user (e.g. warrant canary).

case: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service
definition: The service provider expressly does not claim to provide uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service.

case: The service reviews its privacy policy on a regular basis
definition: Users know the date the privacy policy was last updated and can thus infer the next time it will be reviewed. This gives users more certainty about how long they can trust the current policy to apply.

case: The service will only respond to government requests that are reasonable
definition: The Agreement explains they will disclose personal data about you if it is reasonably necessary to comply with applicable law and government requests.

case: The service will resist legal requests for your information where reasonably possible
definition: The service will attempt to protect user information to a great extent, even so far as stating that they will only follow legal requirements to disclose user information in circumstances where this cannot be reasonably resisted.

case: The terms for this service are easy to read
definition: The Agreements are well-organized, define legal terms (where applicable), aren't needlessly long and may be pleasant to read.

case: The terms for this service are translated into different languages
definition: Although there's generally a unique binding language for the terms, they are translated to allow all users to understand the agreement they're accepting, no matter their native language.

case: The terms may be changed at any time, but you will receive notification of the changes
definition: The Terms may be updated without prior notice, but users will be notified of the changes at the moment they will start applying.

case: There is a date of the last update of the agreements
definition: The given text has a date that allows to know when it was last updated.

case: They may stop providing the service at any time
definition: They may discontinue the services without prior notice, at any time, for any or no reason. They usually assume no liability for losses and damages resulting from this suspension.

case: They store data on you even if you did not interact with the service
definition: Some services store data on you even if you did not provide that data yourself. For example, users might provide access to their address book, after which a service might also store the phone numbers of that person's contacts.

case: Third parties are involved in operating the service
Third parties are not allowed to access your personal information without a legal basis
Third parties used by the service are bound by confidentiality obligations
definition: Some services store data on you even if you did not provide that data yourself. For example, users might provide access to their address book, after which a service might also store the phone numbers of that person's contacts.

case: Third party cookies are employed, but with opt out instructions
Third-party cookies are used for advertising
definition: The service's website sets third-party cookies (cookies that do not belong to their domain) for purposes not including statistics and analytics.

case: Third-party cookies are used for statistics
definition: For instance, Google Analytics, rather than self-hosted (first-party) statistics software.

case: This service assumes no liability for any losses or damages resulting from any matter relating to the service
definition: The service assumes no liability for any damages the user incurs, including tangible (e.g. profits) and intangible losses (e.g. data), resulting from the use or inability to use the service or any other matter relating to the service.

case: This service assumes no liability for unauthorized access to your personal information
This service assumes no responsibility and liability for the contents of links to other websites
definition: The service rejects any responsibility for the contents of other websites to which it links.

case: This service can use your content for all their existing and future services
This service cannot be held responsible for disputes that you may have with other users
definition: You are responsible for the interactions and the disputes that may occur with other users of the Service. In the event of a dispute, you release the Service from all claims resulting from it.

case: This service does not collect, use, or share location data
definition: No location-based information is tracked by the service, so that it cannot be used or shared with third parties.

case: This service does not condone any ideas contained in its user-generated contents
This service does not guarantee that it or the products obtained through it meet your expectations or requirements
definition: This service provider informs its users that the services, information, products, or other materials provided on its website may not meet the users' expectations or requirements.

case: This service fines spammers
definition: Sending unsolicited promotional communications through the Service (i.e. spam) is prohibited and spammers must pay a sum of money as a penalty.

case: This service gives your personal data to third parties involved in its operation
This service has a no refund policy with some exceptions
definition: Payments can be refunded if some requirements are fulfilled.

case: This service holds onto content that you've deleted
definition: Content may remain in backup servers and be retained after deletion, and thus never be completely deleted. This case doesn't apply to contributions that can't be removed due to the nature of the service.

case: This service informs you that its Terms of Service does not apply to third party websites
definition: The service states that whenever it links to third party websites or applications, its Terms of Service does not apply. Those third party websites or applications hosted or operated by other organizations may have their Terms of Service.

case: This service is a subsidiary of Company X
This service is only available for commercial use
definition: Users can't use the Service for individual or personal purposes (unless the Service consents): it is only for business to business (B2B).

case: This service is only available for use individually and non-commercially.
definition: Users can't use the Service for commercial purposes (unless the Service consents): it is only for personal, individual purposes.

case: This service is only available to users over a certain age
definition: The Services are intended for users who are at least a certain age. If you are younger than the age required then you are prohibited from using the Service.

case: This service may collect, use, and share location data
definition: Location-based information is collected and may be used and/or shared with third parties for purposes not directly related to the services provided (i.e. the Service doesn't rely on the use or share of location data to function properly).

case: This service offers a symbolic but nonbinding statement about a matter of opinion, ethics, society, or politics
definition: If a service expresses a worldview antithetical to the user's, that is a good signal that they should not use the service. Or conversely, if the service expresses an uncommonly-held belief that the user agrees with and thinks is relevant to the service-user relationship and/or important, they may wish to use that to choose between otherwise comparable services.

case: This Service provides a list of Third Parties involved in its operation.
definition: The Service provides a list detailing the third parties involved, their roles, and may even provide more information.

case: This service provides a way for you to export your data
This service receives your precise location through GPS coordinates
definition: Unless the service relies on Geo Location, this case is to be assigned to points that don't need your GPS coordinates to function properly.

case: This service reserves the right to disclose your personal information without notifying you
definition: If the Government governing the Terms requests personal data of a user of this service, they may not inform/notify the user while complying with the request.

case: This service retains rights to your content even after you stop using your account
definition: The service may still use your content and display it after you stopped using it by closing your account, since you granted them a perpetual or (in some cases) an unlimited license over that content.

case: This service shares your personal data with third parties that are not essential to its operation
definition: Your personal data is or may be given to third parties nonessential to the service's operation. This could be a business partner that receives your data to provide targeted advertisements.

case: This service still tracks you even if you opted out from tracking
definition: Users can't fully opt out of tracking technologies used for non essential purposes such as advertising, marketing or analytics. The user may be asked for consent for installing some tracking technologies on the device, and even if all are rejected the service will still track its visitors and ignore the choice.This case doesn't apply to functional cookies that are necessary to provide the services.

case: This service takes credit for your content
This service tracks which web page referred you to it
definition: The service logs the URL of the last web page you visited before visiting the Site and may use that information to gather more data about you.

case: This service tracks you on other websites
definition: The service may use tracking technologies in third-party websites to track your online activity while you aren't visiting their Site.

case: This service will continue using anonymized user-generated content after erasure of personal information
definition: If you delete your account or your information from this service, user-generated content such as comments and posts will remain and still be used, but on a pseudonymized or anonymized form so that they can't be linked back to you.

case: Tracking cookies refused will not limit your ability to use the service
definition: Blocking tracking technologies will not negatively impact your use of the service.

case: Tracking pixels are used in service-to-user communication
definition: The service tracks the user count or some actions of the user; this is usually used for statistics. For example, emails sent by a service can contain a pixel tag, which is a small, clear image that can tell them whether or not you have opened an email and what your IP address is.

case: Two factor authentication is provided for your account
definition: The service provides means of further securing your account with two factor authentification, thus greatly improving account security.

case: User accounts can be terminated after having been in breach of the terms of service repeatedly
definition: User accounts can be terminated for having been in breach of the terms of service repeatedly, meaning they cannot be terminated without a reason, but only for a limited number of reasons. Additionally, user accounts will not be deleted after a first infringement.

case: User suspension from the service will be fair and proportionate.
definition: The Service promises to fairly terminate users accounts, only with a reason, and may give them an opportunity to explain and defend themselves.

case: User-generated content can be blocked or censored for any reason
definition: The service reserves the right, for any or no reason, to refuse to post or reject user communications.

case: User-generated content is encrypted, and this service cannot decrypt it
definition: Content generated by the users is end-to-end encrypted, in a way that it can't be accessed by anyone unauthorized, and even the service has no technical means to decrypt it.

case: Usernames can be rejected or changed for any reason
definition: The service's terms explain they may change or remove usernames at their sole discretion, and they may do so without prior notice.

case: Users who have been permanently banned from this service are not allowed to re-register under a new account
definition: Once users have been permanently banned from this service, they are not allowed to create a new account to keep using the service.

case: very broad
Voice data is collected and shared with third-parties
definition: The service collects data and recordings of your voice when you communicate with a service verbally and may use and share them with third parties, that may use this data for marketing or advertising.

case: When the service wants to change its terms, you are notified a week or more in advance.
definition: Users will be notified a week before the Terms are somehow updated, which lets them a reasonable amount of time to carefully read the changes and perhaps stop using the services if they do not longer agree.

case: When the service wants to make a material change to its terms, you are notified at least 30 days in advance
definition: The service may update the Terms without notice, but if they significantly change the agreements in a manner that importantly and/or negatively affects the way the service is used, users will be notified at least 30 days in advance.

case: You agree not to submit illegal content
You agree not to submit libelous, harassing or threatening content
definition: This service prohibits users from submitting content of a variety of types. This can include content that is unlawful, harassing, abusive, threatening, libelous, sexist, racist, homophobic, transphobic, or discriminatory in any other way.

case: You agree not to use the service for illegal purposes
definition: The user agrees not to commit any unlawful acts through the use of the website, including the posting of illegal content or messaging.

case: You agree to comply with the law of the service's country
definition: By using the service, you agree to comply with the applicable laws of the service's jurisdiction, regardless of your location.

case: You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold the service harmless in case of a claim related to your use of the service
You are allowed to quote their content with attribution
You are being tracked via social media cookies/pixels
definition: These types of cookies/pixels send information to social media sites when you interact with the service.

case: You are entitled to a refund if certain thresholds or standards are not met by the service
You are forced into binding arbitration in case of disputes
definition: This service forces users to use their own contracted arbitrator and forces users to waive their rights to jury trial.

case: You are free to choose the type of copyright license that you want to use over your content
definition: You have the right to choose or change the copyright license over content you publish through the Service.

case: You are informed about the risk of publishing personal info online
You are not allowed to use pseudonyms, as trust and transparency between users regarding their identities is relevant to the service.
definition: You must provide your legal name and pseudonyms aren't allowed, but it makes sense for the purposes of this service.

case: You are not being tracked
definition: The document excerpt needs to include the words "[the service] does not track [users]" or "[the service] does not use any tracking technology".

case: You are prohibited from attempting to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems
definition: The service does not allow any attempts at hacking or otherwise gaining unauthorized access to other users' computers.

case: You are prohibited from posting content which promotes violence or politically or religiously extremist values.
You are prohibited from sending chain letters, junk mail, spam or any unsolicited messages
definition: Users are not allowed to use the service for chain letters, junk mail, spamming or any other distribution of content to people who have not agreed to receiving it.

case: You are responsible for any risks, damages, or losses that may incur by downloading materials
definition: Users are responsible for any harm to their computer system or loss of data they may incur through the download of materials from the service.

case: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account
definition: You are responsible for protecting the confidentiality of your password and for maintaining the security of your account. Any activity occurring under your account is your responsibility, whether authorized by you or not.

case: You are solely responsible for claims made against the service and agree to indemnify and hold harmless the service.
definition: You are responsible for your use of the service. If a claim arises related to that use, you agree to indemnify and hold the service harmless. If users are also required to defend the service

case: You are tracked via web beacons, tracking pixels, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting
definition: Tracking technologies (such as web beacons, tracking pixels...) are employed on users and/or the service assigns a unique ID to a browser or device to track its behavior.

case: You are warned of the potential consequences related to third-party access
definition: This is different from disclaiming liability for external links, which is handled by the "This service assumes no responsibility and liability for the contents of links to other websites" case.

case: You aren't allowed to publicly post private messages
definition: The service does not allow users to publicly post private messages they have received from other users.

case: You aren't allowed to remove or edit user-generated content
definition: You cannot edit or remove your content from this service.

case: You aren't forced into binding arbitration in case of disputes
definition: Binding Arbitration is a dispute resolution method involving a neutral third party which will render a decision instead of going to court. Since the arbitrator can decide the outgoing of a dispute without evidences or a legal basis, it is preferable that users decide whether they want or not their dispute to be resolved this way.

case: You authorize the service to charge a credit card supplied on re-occurring basis
definition: You card will be billed on recurring basis unless cancelled. For instance, monthly or annual subscriptions.

case: You can access most of the pages on the service's website without revealing any personal information
You can choose the copyright license
definition: You have the right to choose or change the license over content you publish through the Service.

case: You can choose with whom you share content
definition: Users can decide whether or not they want their content to be shared and they can control how and with whom it is shared.

case: You can delete your content from this service
definition: You can ask the service to remove your content at any time, and it's deleted within a reasonable time.

case: You can limit how your information is used by third-parties and the service
definition: Usually it's related to the right to object to data processing or restrict it under the GDPR. Users may be able to refuse the use of their data for marketing purposes for instance.

case: You can opt out of promotional communications
definition: You can update your account preferences and/or easily unsubscribe of email/sms lists to stop receiving promotional communications.

case: You can opt out of providing personal information to third parties
definition: The Service provides opt-out instructions to the share of (some) personal information with third parties.

case: You can opt out of targeted advertising
definition: The service employs your data to target ads to you, but you can opt-out of this interest-based advertising.

case: You can request access, correction and/or deletion of your data
definition: Users have the right to access personal data hold by the Service, correct it and/or permanently delete it. This usually applies to Services GDPR complaints.

case: You can retrieve an archive of your data
definition: Users can request a copy of the data collected through the services and infer from it the amount of personal information that is processed and stored by the Service. This usually applies to Services GDPR complaints.

case: You can scrape the site, as long as it doesn't impact the server too much
definition: Automated web scraping is a method of extracting information from a website. The service authorizes scraping if it doesn't impact its server(s) too much.

case: You can't close your account if an investigation is ongoing
definition: If an investigation is currently ongoing, you're not allowed to close your account until it's done or in an attempt to avoid investigation.

case: You cannot delete your account of this service
definition: There is no way of deleting your account, which implies that data might be stored forever.

case: You cannot delete your contributions, but it makes sense for this service
definition: For services that are under an open license where your contributions are for public knowledge (such as Wikipedia and ToS;DR).

case: You cannot distribute or disclose your account to third parties
definition: In this context third-parties refers to anyone including friends, family, or company

case: You cannot opt out of promotional communications
definition: This applies to cases where opting out of promotional communications requires sending a written letter by mail or is otherwise more complicated and time consuming than necessary.

case: You have a reduced time period to take legal action against the service
definition: If you wish to bring legal action against a service about a past incident, you may not be able to do so if the Terms you agreed to implied a limited amount of time. As a result it may be worthy to carefully read that section of the Terms to know exactly how much time you might have before your right to take legal action expires.

case: You have the right to leave this service at any time
definition: You can stop using the service and/or cancel or delete your account at any time for any reason. Moreover, the termination is reasonably fast and simple.

case: You have the right to request lower Charges from Third Party Providers
definition: or a service that allows you to buy goods or services from a third party (for instance, an e-commerce platform), the service allows buyers to request a lower price from the seller.

case: You maintain ownership of your content
definition: This service does not claim ownership over user-generated content or materials, and the user doesn't need to waive any moral rights by posting owned content.

case: You must create an account to use this service
definition: You must provide the service with your information in order to use it

case: You must provide your identifiable information
definition: The Service requires users to provide their identifiable information, including phone number, iD number or other information, even though this data collection isn't essential for the purposes of the service. They may still allow pseudonyms in the foreground.

case: You must provide your legal name, pseudonyms are not allowed
definition: You must provide your legal name and pseudonyms aren't allowed. This case doesn't apply to Services for which transparency regarding users identities is relevant for their purposes.

case: You must report to the service any unauthorized use of your account or any breach of security
definition: The service asks the user to notify them immediately of any unauthorized use or security breaches.

case: You shall not interfere with another person's enjoyment of the service
definition: Users are asked not to interfere with another person't enjoyment in using the service. However, this statement is very vague and open to interpretation by the service itself.

case: You should revisit the terms periodically, although in case of material changes, the service will notify
definition: The service may update the Terms without notice, but if they significantly change the agreements in a manner that importantly and/or negatively affects the way the service is used, users will be notified.

case: You waive your moral rights
definition: Moral rights are rights to creators of literary, dramatic, musical and artistic works, as well as directors of films. "The moral rights include the right of attribution, the right to have a work published anonymously or pseudonymously, and the right to the integrity of the work. The preserving of the integrity of the work allows the author to object to alteration, distortion, or mutilation of the work that is "prejudicial to the author's honor or reputation". Anything else that may detract from the artist's relationship with the work even after it leaves the artist's possession or ownership may bring these moral rights into play. Moral rights are distinct from any economic rights tied to copyrights. Even if an artist has assigned his or her copyright rights to a work to a third party, he or she still maintains the moral rights to the work." -Wikipedia In general, any terms that use the exact words "moral rights" as rights that are waived will fall under this Case.

case: You waive your right to a class action.
definition: The right to be represented in a class action (or representative action) exists in the US and some European countries. It allows people who have been similarly injured by the same accused to take legal action by a single lawsuit instead of individually. Some Terms of Service try to limit that right. By agreeing to them, you could waive (= renounce to) your right to a class action, which might reduce your chances to be successful in a case.

case: You will be notified about website maintenance
definition: Users will be notified before their experience is impacted due to website maintenance.

case: You will be notified if personal data has been affected by data breaches
definition: Should the personal information of a service be compromised, the service will inform users if any personal data has been affected by data breaches. This case is also related to privacy.

case: Your account can be deleted without prior notice and without a reason
definition: At any time, your account can be terminated without explanation and without warning by the service.

case: Your account can be suspended for several reasons
Your biometric data is collected
definition: This service can collect or use your biometric data. This includes but is not limited to facial recognition, fingerprints, and iris scans. Although this feature can sometimes be convenient to the user, providing this type of information to the service could open your personal data to being sold or stolen.

case: Your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) headers are respected
definition: This service does respect the browser's Do Not Track header and disables all user tracking if it is enabled.

case: Your browsing history can be viewed by the service
definition: The service can view your search history and the websites you visit, which is an extremely intrusive way of collecting information that may include personal and/or sensitive data.

case: Your content can be deleted if you violate the terms
definition: Content infringing the Terms of Service (or the Acceptable Use Policy or equivalent) may be removed, with or without notice.

case: Your content can be distributed through any media known now or in the future
Your content can be licensed to third parties
definition: By posting content through the Services, users grant them a transferable and/or sublicensable right, which allows user content to be licensed to third parties.

case: Your data is processed and stored in a country that is friendlier to user privacy protection
definition: The Terms are governed by the applicable laws of a jurisdiction known for strong data regulations and user privacy protection. Usually contributors will need to explain in the Analysis view of each point linked to this Case the reason why it shall be applied.

case: Your data is processed and stored in a country that is less friendly to user privacy protection
definition: This case means that user data is not anywhere in the world, but somewhere where it is more likely to be obtained and used by government and/or possible data analysts.

case: Your data may be processed and stored anywhere in the world
definition: Your data is stored all over the world, including in countries where data protection rules may differ from the ones of the service's jurisdiction or those of your country jurisdiction.

case: Your feedback is invited regarding changes to the terms.
definition: The Service takes user suggestions into account to update its Terms.

case: Your identity is used in ads that are shown to other users
definition: Ads shown to other users may include a reference to you as an implied endorsement. Might give away information about your own personal lifestyle to strangers.

case: Your information is only shared with third parties when given specific consent
definition: The service does not share user information with any third parties unless users specifically give it permission to do so.

case: Your IP address is collected, which can be used to view your approximate location
Your personal data is aggregated into statistics
definition: Your personal data is used for statistics in a de-identified/aggregated form (i.e. not directly linked to a unique identity) to analyze trends, for research and for analytics.

case: Your personal data is not shared with third parties
definition: Information collected from users by this service is not given to third parties.

case: Your personal data is not sold
definition: This service makes an explicit promise not to sell "personal data" of users.

case: Your personal data is used for advertising
definition: Your interaction with the service and data you have shared with them may be gathered to create an advertising ID or profile to target ads on you, either on the website you were visiting or in third party websites.

case: Your personal data is used for limited purposes
definition: Your Personal Data is only used for the essential purposes of the Service, which are clearly defined on the Agreements. For instance, the Service won't abuse your data to deliver targeted advertisements to you or for marketing purposes.

case: Your personal data is used to employ targeted third-party advertising
definition: Your Personal Information is traded and shared with advertising companies to target ads on you, either on the website you were visiting or in third party websites. Your interaction with the service and data you have shared with them may be gathered to create an advertising ID or profile.

case: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction
definition: If the service gets acquired or is involved in a merger, bankruptcy, reorganization or sale, your personal data may be transferred or sold.

case: Your Personal data may be sold unless you opt out
definition: There is a form to opt-out (typically California's CCPA) of the selling of your personal data. This is a bad a point because there are many services that don't have this form due to not selling your data in the first place.

case: Your personal data may be used for marketing purposes
definition: The service may use your personal data for marketing, such as sending you personalized offerings.

case: Your personal data will not be used for an automated decision-making
definition: The service promises not to use your personal data for automated decision-making, including profiling.

case: Your personal information is used for many different purposes
definition: Personal Data can be processed for many reasons, including non essential processing such as for advertising, marketing and analytics purposes.

case: Your private content may be accessed by people working for the service
Your profile is combined across various products
definition: When using multiple services from one same company, they can combine these (unrelated) information sources about you to build up a single richer user profile about you.

case: Your provided identifiable information is actively checked by the service
definition: The service checks if the required identifiable information you've provided is correct, and may do so on a regular basis. The check measures could be analyzing your browser information and/or providing the identifiable information to a third-party or the authority, thus compromising your anonymity.

case: Your use is throttled
definition: The service may impose limits or restrictions to the use of the service, thus negatively impacting users experience. They may do so without reason or prior notice.
